com.cyc.session

Interface SessionManagerConfiguration


  • public interface SessionManagerConfiguration
    Configuration parameters for a SessionManager. Any given CycSession will be configured by a CycSessionConfiguration, whereas a SessionManagerConfiguration configures the SessionManager which produces and manages CycSessions.

    SessionManagerConfiguration implementations should be immutable, or at least unmodifiable, and a SessionManager should receive exactly one instance, during its instantiation.

    See Also:
    SessionManagerConfigurationProperties

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      SessionOptions.DefaultSessionOptions getDefaultSessionOptions()
      Returns an immutable set of options, which may provide the default values for CycSession.getOptions().
      Properties getRawProperties()
      Returns a copy of the original Properties object used to initialize the SessionManagerConfiguration implementation.
      boolean isConfigurationCachingAllowed()
      Is the SessionManager permitted to cache configurations? This is useful when loading configurations is expensive or annoying.
      boolean isGuiInteractionAllowed()
      Does this configuration allow for the end-user to be prompted for configuration properties via GUI elements in windowed environments? If so, and if no other sufficient configuration has specified, and if the application is not running in a headless environment, the Session API may prompt the end-user for configuration information.
      boolean isServerPatchingAllowed()
      Are the APIs permitted to apply code patches to the Cyc server? Note that this setting only determines whether the rules of the CycSession will allow code patches; patches may still be prohibited by the Cyc server or the API implementation, regardless of this setting.
      boolean isServerReleasedWhenAllSessionsAreClosed()
      When all sessions are closed, should any underlying connections be released?
      boolean isSessionAutoCreationAllowed()
      Can CycSessions be automatically created as necessary?
      boolean isSessionCachingAllowed()
      Is the SessionManager permitted to cache sessions?

    • Method Detail

      • isConfigurationCachingAllowed

        boolean isConfigurationCachingAllowed()
        Is the SessionManager permitted to cache configurations? This is useful when loading configurations is expensive or annoying. If this option is set to false, the SessionManager will attempt to load a configuration for each and every session it creates, which can be fantastically annoying if it is doing so by interactively prompting the user.
        Returns:
        can configurations be cached?

      • isGuiInteractionAllowed

        boolean isGuiInteractionAllowed()
        Does this configuration allow for the end-user to be prompted for configuration properties via GUI elements in windowed environments? If so, and if no other sufficient configuration has specified, and if the application is not running in a headless environment, the Session API may prompt the end-user for configuration information.
        Returns:
        is system allowed to prompt end-user for configuration properties via GUI elements?
        See Also:
        SessionManagerConfigurationProperties.GUI_INTERACTION_ALLOWED_KEY, SessionManagerConfigurationProperties.GUI_INTERACTION_ALLOWED_DEFAULT_VALUE

      • isServerPatchingAllowed

        boolean isServerPatchingAllowed()
        Are the APIs permitted to apply code patches to the Cyc server? Note that this setting only determines whether the rules of the CycSession will allow code patches; patches may still be prohibited by the Cyc server or the API implementation, regardless of this setting. Defaults to false.
        Returns:
        can code patches be applied to the Cyc server?
        See Also:
        SessionManagerConfigurationProperties.SERVER_PATCHING_ALLOWED_KEY, SessionManagerConfigurationProperties.SERVER_PATCHING_ALLOWED_DEFAULT_VALUE

      • isServerReleasedWhenAllSessionsAreClosed

        boolean isServerReleasedWhenAllSessionsAreClosed()
        When all sessions are closed, should any underlying connections be released?
        Returns:
        should connections be released when all sessions are closed?
        See Also:
        SessionManagerConfigurationProperties.SERVER_RELEASED_WHEN_ALL_SESSIONS_CLOSED_KEY, SessionManagerConfigurationProperties.SERVER_RELEASED_WHEN_ALL_SESSIONS_CLOSED_DEFAULT_VALUE

      • isSessionAutoCreationAllowed

        boolean isSessionAutoCreationAllowed()
        Can CycSessions be automatically created as necessary?
        Returns:
        whether CycSessions be automatically created as necessary?
        See Also:
        SessionManagerConfigurationProperties.SESSION_AUTO_CREATION_ALLOWED_KEY, SessionManagerConfigurationProperties.SESSION_AUTO_CREATION_ALLOWED_DEFAULT_VALUE

      • isSessionCachingAllowed

        boolean isSessionCachingAllowed()
        Is the SessionManager permitted to cache sessions?
        Returns:
        can sessions be cached?

      • getDefaultSessionOptions

        SessionOptions.DefaultSessionOptions getDefaultSessionOptions()
        Returns an immutable set of options, which may provide the default values for CycSession.getOptions().
        Returns:
        An immutable set of default options

      • getRawProperties

        Properties getRawProperties()
        Returns a copy of the original Properties object used to initialize the SessionManagerConfiguration implementation.

        If the implementing class was initialized with a Properties object, this method will return an exact copy of that Properties object. This may mean that it will contain properties which are not used by the Session API; for example, in the case of a SessionManagerConfiguration initialized by a call to System.getProperties().

        If the implementing class was not initialized by a Properties object, it is up to the implementation to determine what to return; see the implementation's javadoc.

        Regardless of implementation, this method should never return null; it should always return, at least, an empty Properties object. Each call to this method will return a fresh copy of the Properties; changes to the Properties will not be persisted. Likewise, changing values in the resulting Properties object will not change the values returned by any methods on the SessionManagerConfiguration object.

        Returns:
        a non-null Properties object.
